content.question: Lewis diagrams of molecules of three different hydrocarbons are shown above. Which of the following claims about the molecules is best supported by the diagrams?

choices.label: All the atoms in molecule 1 lie in one plane.
All the molecules have the same empirical formula.

The <math alttext="C C C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C-</mtext><mtext>C-</mtext><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> bond angle in molecule 2 is close to <math alttext="180 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>180</mn><mi>Â°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The strongest carbon-to-carbon bond occurs in molecule 3.

content.answer: The strongest carbon-to-carbon bond occurs in molecule 3.

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
